Key Match Events: Kyle Walker scored the opening goal for England with a cross that deflected into the net.
Morten Hjulmand scored Denmark's equalizer from outside the box, forcing a save from Jordan Pickford.
Harry Kane became the third player to score at four different major international tournaments for England, alongside Michael Owen and Wayne Rooney.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Gareth Southgate chose to stick with the same starting XI for the fifth time in his 97 games in charge of England.
England started strongly but went into their shell after taking the lead, leading to a disappointing performance.
Post-Match Reflections: England gained a point that puts them in a strong position to win the group, but they will want to improve after their underwhelming performance.
Gareth Southgate was unhappy with the team's performance and made several substitutions to try to turn things around.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was breaking up, causing players on both sides to slip over all night.
Only 13 goals have been scored from outside the penalty area at Euro 2024, accounting for 28.3% of the goals so far.
